title: Stacey Solomon criticises Coleen Rooney for Rebekah Vardy accusations
text:
Stacey Solomon has criticised Coleen Rooney (Picture: Getty)

Stacey Solomon has criticised Coleen Rooney for her decision to publicly accuse Rebekah Vardy of selling stories to newspapers.

Speaking on Loose Women, Stacey admitted that although she understood why Coleen would be ‘really upset and really hurt’ she felt Coleen needed to speak directly to Jamie Vardy’s wife.

‘I understand why she would be really upset and really hurt and want to out that person. But unless you have a conversation with somebody you can’t get a real gist of whether they have done it or not,’ she said.

‘She hasn’t actually outed Rebekah Vardy, she said Rebekah Vardy’s account, which leaves it open to anything. What do you achieve with that?

‘I don’t really understand.’

Colleen Rooney accused Rebekah Vardy of selling stories to the press (Instagram)

But Stacey, ever the diplomat, added that she felt Rebekah’s actions were also telling, as she shared: ‘I don’t get Rebekah Vardy’s side either because if I was her and I knew I had done nothing, I wouldn’t even reply, I would just send a lawyer’s letter.’

Wayne Rooney’s wife made the accusations on Instagram, alleging that she set up a plot to expose her fellow WAG.

Rebekah has denied all the allegations (Picture: PA)

However, Rebekah has denied all the allegations and has called on lawyers to find out who had access to her Instagram and when.

The mum-of-four, who is married to Wayne Rooney, has yet to post the alleged screenshots.

Rebekah, 37, is currently pregnant with her fifth child, her third with footballer Jamie Vardy. The WAG achieved further fame in 2017 when she appeared on I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here!

She and Coleen became pals as their husband played alongside each other for England.
